Text saved: The Hunger Games is an event that happens every year. The Capitol uses the games to punish the people in the districts. The districts are the different parts of the country. The Capitol punishes them because they fought against the government. Every year, a lottery chooses one boy and one girl from each district. They are between 12 and 18 years old. These teenagers are called 'tributes'. A tribute is a person who must fight in the games. They all fight, but only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country must watch the games on television.
